deductible.definition: The amount you pay before insurance starts helping

copay.definition: The amount you pay each time you get medicine

coinsurance.definition: The percentage you pay after meeting your deductible

out-of-pocket-maximum.definition: The most you pay in one year

formulary.definition: Your insurance's covered medication list - the medicines they will help pay for

covered-medication-list.definition: The list of medicines your insurance will help pay for (also called a formulary)

generic.definition: A medicine that works the same as the brand name but costs less

prior-authorization.definition: When insurance makes your doctor ask permission before covering a medicine

specialty-pharmacy.definition: A mail-order pharmacy for expensive or special medicines

pap.definition: Patient Assistance Program - free or low-cost medicine from drug companies

foundation-grant.definition: Money from a charity to help pay for medicine

calcineurin-inhibitor.definition: A type of anti-rejection drug that prevents your immune system from attacking your new organ. Examples: tacrolimus (Prograf) and cyclosporine (Neoral)

immunosuppressant.definition: Anti-rejection drugs - medicines that lower your immune system to protect your transplanted organ

anti-rejection-drugs.definition: Medicines that prevent your body from rejecting your transplanted organ by lowering your immune response

antimetabolite.definition: A type of anti-rejection drug that slows the growth of cells that could attack your new organ. Examples: mycophenolate (CellCept) and azathioprine (Imuran)

corticosteroid.definition: A medicine that reduces swelling and calms your immune system. Examples: prednisone and methylprednisolone

induction-therapy.definition: Strong anti-rejection medicines given right after transplant surgery to prevent early rejection

maintenance-therapy.definition: Anti-rejection medicines you take every day for the rest of your life after transplant

trough-level.definition: A blood test taken right before your next dose to check if you have the right amount of medicine in your body
